channel.title: Autodocs :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: One of the biggest innovations in documenting software was the development of autodocumentation tools. These were programs that would read source code files, and combine information parsed from the code itself and information contained in code comments to generate documentation in an easy-to-distribute form (often HTML). One of the earliest examples of this approach came from the programming language Java, whose API specification was generated from the language source files using JavaDoc.
